summary: This is an internal email from a U.S. Attorney's Office contractor, likely in the SDNY, listing exhibits pulled for a grand jury (GX) presentation related to the Epstein/Maxwell case. The email references photos, records, and other evidence compiled before a colleague went on leave.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in the list of exhibits; a photo of him from a photobook was pulled for the grand jury presentation.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced in the list of exhibits; a photo of her from a photobook was pulled for the grand jury presentation.

connections.description: Both are listed as subjects of photos pulled from a photobook for the same grand jury presentation, indicating their joint association in the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Exhibit Compilation Email
events.description: An internal email is sent listing exhibits (photos, records, etc.) that were pulled for a grand jury (GX) presentation related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) compiled a list of exhibits for a grand jury presentation, including photos of Epstein and Maxwell from a photobook.

Evidence pulled included photos of people (with some names redacted), photos of places (including Ghislaine Maxwell's London townhouse), FedEx records, flight records, AT&T records, a deposition, Mar-A-Lago records, maps, and a paralegal specialist's sworn statement.
The email indicates an active grand jury process was underway in September 2021, with evidence being organized by prosecutors.
